definition: the Old World/Eurasia as opposed to the New World 新大陸|新大陆[xin1 da4 lu4] or the Americas
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Old World climbing plant with hard-shelled bottle-shaped gourds as fruits.
sentences.chinese: 舊大陸攀援植物，有硬殼的瓶狀果實。

sentences.english: Old World herb related to fenugreek.
sentences.chinese: 與葫蘆巴相關的舊大陸草本植物。

sentences.english: Old World genus of tropical evergreen usually spiny shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 通常多刺的熱帶灌木的舊大陸的屬。

sentences.english: Genus of old world hominoids; miocene and pliocene.
sentences.chinese: 中新世和上新世的舊大陸人科的一屬。

sentences.english: Old World star of Bethlehem having edible young shoots.
sentences.chinese: 舊大陸的一種虎眼萬年青，具有可食的幼苗。

sentences.english: Old World genus of isopod crustaceans.
sentences.chinese: 陸生等足甲殼類舊大陸鼠婦科的一屬。

sentences.english: Old World genus of the family Cruciferae.
sentences.chinese: 舊大陸十字花科的一個屬。

sentences.english: Old World perennial plants grown for their showy flowers.
sentences.chinese: 舊大陸中因其豔麗花朵而種植的一個多年生植物屬。

sentences.english: Old World finches: e. g. canaries and serins.
sentences.chinese: 舊大陸雲雀，如白玉鳥和金絲雀。
